alert.note: Alert for Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 11:58AM CDT until September 04 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Cherokee and Etowah. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1158 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Leesburg, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Western Weiss Lake, Blanche, Little River Falls, Eastern Weiss Lake, Cherokee Rock Village, Tabor Road, Slackland, Chesnut Bay Resort, Yellow Creek Falls, Weiss Dam, Broomtown, Fullerton, New Moon and Chesterfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
